channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.description:
Report E-2023100713

item.title: Report E-2023100727
item.description:
Report E-2023100727

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO reported the release of approximately 3- gallons of “Glypure 70” UN3265 from 2-6 gallon plastic jugs that were crushed by a pallet. The release Impacted an area of 5’X5’ on the trailer floor. No soil or drains were impacted. First Call Environmental cleaned and recovered the released “Glypure 70” UN3265 with absorbents and used PU-UP to neutralize the trailer floor. Hazmat contractor reported that they found 2 damaged jugs and 30 undamaged jugs.

item.title: Report E-2023100645
item.description:
Report E-2023100645

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: WEST CHESTER
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When loading a pallet of drums into a trailer, material handler observed one of the drums slightly leaking from the bottom. Further investigation revealed that a protruding nail in the pallet that the drums were staged on had punctured the bottom of the drum contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and the drum was repaired with drum putty and put into a recovery container.

item.title: Report E-2023100596

Report E-2023100596

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one case of trufuel 50 fuel (un1203) damaging one of the inner metal 1 gallon can and releasing 1 gallon of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the one poly 330 gallon tote of conversion coating (un3264) had a crack in the body and had released an ounce of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023091061
item.description:
Report X-2023091061

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED TO QA LEAKING GASOLINE. PACKAGE WAS CLEAN UP AND PLACED IN HAZMAT CAGE. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN HAZMAT CAGE

item.title: Report X-2023091063
item.description:
Report X-2023091063

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived at QA, leaking from the singulator. 1 out of the 4 Pool Essentials Chlorinating Liquid 1 gallon spilled, due to a loose cap. DescribePack: Loose cap on one of the Chlorinating liquids 1 gallon DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The Chlorinating Liquids 1 gallon were placed in a hazardous bag zip tied and in a yellow drum.

item.title: Report X-2023080912
item.description:
Report X-2023080912

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-24T00:32:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: Plymouth Meeting
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 17th at 0430 a CSX train operating on Norfolk Southern tracks went over sink hole resulting in 16 railcars to derail with no release. Local authorities responded and evacuated nearby residence until SHPX 220652 could be confirmed no releases. Once confirmed no releases evacuation was lifted. The report is being submitted for the evacuation only.
